description.narrative:
Syftet med insatsen är att ge de offentliga universiteten i Bolivia verktyg för att skydda immateriella rättigheter och produkter som uppstått som resultat av forskning och innovation.
En konsult ska kontrakteras för att bistå företaget Swebol Biotech SRL i att ta fram patenträttigheter som ger företaget möjlighet att nå ut på den internationella marknaden med sina produkter. Företaget är ett joint venture mellan universitetsforskare i Bolivia och Sverige som uppstått som spin-off av det Sida-finansierat forskningsstödet till bolivianska universitet.
Sverige har under 15 år gett stöd till att utveckla forskningskapacitet och innovationssystem hos två offentliga universitet i Bolivia. Som ett resultat av forskningssamarbetet har några mindre joint venture företag skapats. Dessa har, om än i liten skala, lyckats etablera produkter på den bolivianska och den internationella marknaden.
Swebol Biotech uppstod ur ett samarbete inom jordbruk- och livsmedelsforskning på San Andrés universitetet (UMSA) i La Paz och Lunds Universitet. Företaget har i samarbete med lokala jordbrukare på det andinska höglandet använt sig av konceptet rättvis handel, förädlat quinoa och andra grödor. Samarbetet har lett till att livsmedelsprodukter utvecklats. En viss export sker redan av quinoa till Sverige genom företaget ”Green Go”.
San Andrés universitetet saknar idag verktyg för att skydda immateriella rättigheter och produkter som tagits fram genom forskningsarbete. Detta innebär en stor risk för att dessa produkter plagieras och marknadsförs av andra aktörer.
Insatsen är ett led i Svenska Ambassaden i La Paz strategi att brygga mellan det traditionella biståndet mot ett ökat handels- och tekniskt utbyte mellan Bolivia och Sverige.

The aim of the contribution is to provide the public universities in Bolivia with tools to protect the intellectual property rights for products stemming from research and innovation. A consultant will be contracted to support the company Swebol Biotech SRL in establishing patent rights in order to gain access to the international market. The company is a joint venture between university researchers in Bolivia and Sweden.
Sweden has over the past 15 years supported research capacity building and innovation systems at two public universities in Bolivia in cooperation with Swedish universities. As a result of this cooperation a few joint venture companies have emerged that target (albeit in a small scale) the Bolivian and the international markets.
Swebol Biotech emerged as a result of innovations from the agricultural and food market research at the San Andrés University (UMSA) in La Paz in collaboration with Lund University, Sweden. The company has in collaboration with local Andean farmers, applying the fair trade concept, improved the quality of quinoa and other grains. It has developed various products for the international market. Some of these products are already exported and marketed through the Swedish company “Green Go”.
However, at present the San Andrés University does not have the knowledge or the tools to protect innovations stemming from research activities. There is an increasing risk that products developed by the researchers may be plagiarized and marketed by other companies if property rights are not secured.
The contribution is part of the Swedish Embassy in La Paz strategy to bridge between traditional development cooperation towards commercial and technical cooperation beyond aid.

The Consultant is expected to deliver the following products:
1. An inception report including methodological approach, time schedule and detail on the products to be delivered.
2. A survey (report) of international patent rights on products similar to the ones Swebol Biotech SRL plans to acquire.
3. All the documents required for the patent rights application in the markets: Argentina, Brazil, Canada, China including Hong Kong, United States and the European Union.
4. Claim register on behalf of Swebol Biotech AB and Swebol Biotech SRL.
5. A summary report that provide Swebol and DIPGIS/UMSA with the information needed to carry out patent rights application for other emerging enterprises originating from research activities within the university.
6. Registration of Swebol as a brand name in the same countries as for the patent.

description.narrative: The consultants have delivered according to contract.A "handbook" (Commercialization of ideas and Intellectual Property with a focus on Patents enclosed) has been written and delivered.The handbook may serve as guidelines to joint university-private sector co-operations in Bolivia.The handbook was presented at two different IP-seminars held by Dr Fredrik Carlsson from Ström & Gulliksson on December 4, 2017 in Cochabamba and on December 6, 2017 in La Paz with 30-40 participants and one in Cochabamba with 60-70 participants.The IP-seminars focused on the process for commercializing IP and then an overview on intellectual property rights was given with patents as an important point. At both seminars, the attendants were mainly students and researchers from the university. In addition, representatives from the Swedish Embassy and SIDA as well as the patent office in Bolivia (SENAPI) also attended the seminars.A complete international application covering the generalized invention as well as specific embodiments thereof (which are not covered by the previously filed applications) was drafted.In order to support the drafting process, patent databases were searched and a report listing patents and patent application relating to methods and products similar to the ones disclosed in the filed international application PCT/SE2017/050790 was provided.In total 644 documents were briefly analyzed, of which 25 were chosen for deeper analysis.The international application (the second PCT-application) was filed on February 1, 2018 as PCT/EP2018/052512 with the European Patent Office as the receiving office (RO) and international searching authority (ISA).Further, the second PCT-application was translated into Spanish and a corresponding Bolivian application (Bolivia is not contracting state to the PCT) claiming the priority of the second PCT-application was filed on the same day, i.e. February 1, 2018.Applications1 for registering the trademark "Quiny" have been filed in the European Union, Brazil, Bolivia and Chile.Swebol has proven to be a good example of results from research collaboration beyon the actual research collaboration. The contribution has been a learning experience for all parties. As the consultancy firm was new to cooperation and the different requirements and of Sida and Sida/The Embassy is new to this kind of collaboration it has been in times difficult to understand each other and fully communicate what is expected of the different parties. The interest in the products from the study (handbok and seminars) has been large and the contribution has fulfilled the ambition of providing a case of how to move outside the University world to the market.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
